Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Interface TaskGraphExecutionResult

public interface TaskGraphExecutionResult
Defines the result of a task graph execution. The result is the output of a set of explicitly select nodes in the task execution graph.

Thread safety

Implementations of TaskGraphExecutionResult are expected to be (effectively) immutable. Therefore, they must also be safely accessible from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of TaskGraphExecutionResult are expected to be synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • TaskGraphExecutorProperties.getResultNodeKeys()
  • TaskGraphExecutor

  • Method Details

    • getResultType

      ExecutionResultType getResultType()
      Returns if the task graph execution completed completely successfully or not. Note that you must have set the deliverResultOnFailure property of the executor to true for this method to be useful. If you didn't, this method will always return ExecutionResultType.SUCCESS because in every other case, the result will not be provided (instead, the execution will complete exceptionally).
      Returns:
      if the task graph execution completed completely successfully or not. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • TaskGraphExecutorProperties.isDeliverResultOnFailure()

    • getResult

      <R> R getResult(TaskNodeKey<R,?> key)
      Returns the output of the task node identified by the given TaskNodeKey.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the output of the node
      Parameters:
      key - the TaskNodeKey identifying the node whose output is to be retrieved. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the output of the task node identified by the given TaskNodeKey. This method may return null only if the queried node can produce a null output.
      Throws:
      CompletionException - thrown if the task node action or one if its dependencies has failed with an exception. The cause of the CompletionException contains the exception thrown during the computation.
      OperationCanceledException - thrown if computation was canceled before this node could have been computed
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the output of the given task is not available because it was not specified as required
